meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I dug a hole in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She dug up some potatoes for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The dog dug up my favorite shoe again!
meanings.sent4: Her words dug deep into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully dug through the layers of soil.

meanings.definition: a simple past tense and past participle of dig
meanings.sent1: He dug a tunnel under the fence.
meanings.sent2: They have dug a well in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The kids dug for buried treasure in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree dug deep into the ground.
meanings.sent5: The miners dug for coal deep underground.

meanings.definition: to break up, turn over, or remove earth, sand, etc., as with a shovel, spade, bulldozer, or claw; make an excavation.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers dug a trench for the new pipeline.
meanings.sent2: She dug out a space for the new flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The kids dug a moat around their sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologists dug carefully to uncover the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The gardener dug up the weeds to make space for new plants.
